lines.transliteration_english: Sabad Surati Avagaahan Kai Saadhasangi , Aatam Tarang Gang Saagar Lahari Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: When a Sikh joins in the holy congregation and become engrossed in the divine word, the ecstasy of the spiritual waves felt by him is like the waves of the ocean.

lines.gurmukhi: Agm AQwih Awih Apr Apwr Aiq rqn pRgws iniD pUrn ghir hY
lines.transliteration_english: Agam Adaahi Aahi Apar Apaar Ati , Ratan Pragaas Nidhi Pooran Gahari Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: The ocean-like Lord is beyond our reach and its depth is unfathomable. One who stays engrossed in Naam Simran and adulations of the Lord is able to realise the jewel-like treasure of the Almighty.

lines.gurmukhi: hMs mrjIvw gun gwhk cwhk sMq ins idn Gitkw mhUrq phr hY
lines.transliteration_english: Hans Marajeevaa Goun Gaahak Chaahak Santa , Nis Din Ghatikaa Mahoorat Pahar Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: The true disciple and seeker of the Lord remains a trader for the jewel-like traits of the Lord's name and he is never affected by the time of the day or night, watch, auspiciousness of the time and other rites and rituals.

lines.transliteration_english: Svaant Boond Barakhaa Jiu Gavan Ghataa Ghamanda , Hot Moukataahal Au Nar Narahar Hai ?76?

Shabad OS B.translation: As the Swati raindrop becomes a precious pearl when it falls on a clam in the deep sea, similarly when a Sikh experiences the divine unstruck music in the tenth opening (Dasam Duar) as a result of Naam Simran, he becomes God from the form of a human being
